discourse_list.title: Can't see EIP-3664 on the list. Interested in knowing why

content.content: I’ve heard the concept of EIP-3664 for a very long time. Some NFT project is created based on it even though it’s just an EIP. So today I just wanted to check what’s the current status of it. But, I surprisingly found that I couldn’t find it anywhere in https://eips.ethereum.org/. Really don’t know why. I thought - well if it’s not approved at least it should be under like withdraw or stagnant? Anyone has any ideas? Really curious what’s the rule.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is asking why they can't find EIP-3664 on the Ethereum Improvement Proposals website. They express curiosity about the status of the proposal and wonder if it has been rejected or is still under consideration. The post does not contain entirely positive or negative feedback on the proposal, but rather a request for information.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: can anyone help me to understand it?

The PR for EIP-3664 hasn’t been merged.   github.com/ethereum/EIPs         Add EIP-3664: Metaverse NFTs   ethereum:master ← DRepublic-io:master            opened 05:47AM - 17 Jul 21 UTC               nimocat             +383 -0       When opening a pull request to submit a new EIP, please use the suggested templa…te: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/eip-template.md  We have a GitHub bot that automatically merges some PRs. It will merge yours immediately if certain criteria are met:   - The PR edits only existing draft PRs.  - The build passes.  - Your GitHub username or email address is listed in the 'author' header of all affected PRs, inside <triangular brackets>.  - If matching on email address, the email address is the one publicly listed on your GitHub profile.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving information about proposal status
3rd party giving instructions for submitting EIPs
3rd party explaining criteria for automatic merging of PRs

content.content: EIP-3664 doesn’t exist right now and has never existed. Considering the lack of activity on the part of the author, it is unlikely that it will exist.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving negative feedback on proposal

content.content: Thanks for your reply. As far as I know, couple of projects are based on EIP-3664, like Cradles and MM3NFT. If EIP doesn’t exist anymore, how will that affect the projects? Will they become…like illegal?
So, that means only if an EIP is merged, it will be listed here - All | Ethereum Improvement Proposals. Am I understanding it correctly?

ScallionSteak:  So, that means only if an EIP is merged, it will be listed here - All | Ethereum Improvement Proposals.   Merging means it is visible from the EIP website and has met some basic minimum requirements, predominantly around formatting and basic content to become a draft EIP.  This is only the first step in the process for an EIP.     ScallionSteak:  If EIP doesn’t exist anymore, how will that affect the projects? Will they become…like illegal?   Projects can create standards, it doesn’t need to be an EIP.  In fact it is often better for ERCs to be developed only after successful use of features by multiple projects. See: What kinds of things should be standardized? – William Entriken Blog
That sounds nice. Thanks for your clarification.
